news_header: Apple launches iPhone 16e with AI features at lower cost, aiming to boost sales and attract new customers.
news_original_title: Apple gambles on new iPhone with AI features at lower cost
news_text: Apple has announced the iPhone 16e, featuring AI capabilities at a lower price point than its flagship models. It shares the same processor as the iPhone 16 but has fewer cameras and lower specs. The device aims to rejuvenate sales after a decline in iPhone sales. Pre-orders start on February 21 in 59 countries, priced at £599 in the UK. Analysts are cautious about the sales impact of the new AI features, but Apple hopes to attract new users and enhance its ecosystem.
